title: Black Graduate Engineering and Science Students
description: BGESS was founded in 1987 by a group of African American graduate students enrolled at U.C. Berkeley. BGESS has dedicated itself to the nurturing of academic and social support systems for students of African Heritage, whose contributions to the fields of Graduate Engineering and Physical Sciences have been historically underrepresented or denied. They provide information about applying to Cal, historic contributions by Black scientists and engineers, and Future Black Faculty Database.
